body: On the surface, Marie Troy, 51, and her daughter Nicole Abbate, 17, seem to have hit a rough patch -- the product of bad luck, perhaps, or a bad year. But a short conversation with them reveals that the road their lives have taken has been bumpy all along, with so many detours that being sidetracked has become the norm. Ms. Troy's first major
title: THE NEEDIEST CASES; Mother and Daughter Persevere Despite Health Problems

body: I MADE a list of the 15 best things I ate in New York City in the past year of reviewing restaurants for The New York Times. It is an accounting that comprises restaurant dishes of uncommon excellence and flavor. Together they underscore New York's place as one of the planet's best cities in which to dine out. And we'll get to them soon enough. But
title: CRITIC'S NOTEBOOK; From the File Marked '2010 Delicious'

body: The New York Aviators, a minor league hockey team based in Brooklyn, lost their first three games of the season on the road. After another long bus ride -- from Chenango, N.Y., to Alexandria Bay near the Canadian border -- they arrived later than expected for a game against the Thousand Island Privateers. ''We barely had time to warm up,''
title: Pro Hockey Is Taking Its Best Shot In Brooklyn

body: They call it the dead-man feature. In the spartan, phone-booth-size motorman's cab in a subway train, there is a metal arm a few inches long called the controller. To set the train in motion, the operator presses down on the controller arm with several pounds of pressure, swivels it and holds on. If he lets go, for whatever reason, the emergency
title: A Safety Feature Kicks In as a Train Loses Its Driver

author: E-mail: habitats@nytimes.com
body: THE journey that took Filipp and Raya Katz to the red brick and beige stone house that Ms. Katz calls ''my little palace'' began more than half a century ago in the Ukrainian city of Mukachevo, near the Hungarian border. The Katzes, now both in their mid-50s, grew up on the same street, and knew each other as children. A particular bond was the
title: HABITATS; The House of Open Arms
